results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.

results.title: The Godfather. Part II (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Coppola Company and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description:
In this sequel to “The Godfather”, set in 1940s-50s, Michael Corleone has taken over his father’s mantle as head of the powerful Mafia family. Director Coppola tells two stories - the roots and rise of a young Don Vito, played by Robert De Niro, and the ascension of Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) as the new Don. Throughout the film, flashback sequences shot in a neorealist style, parallel the two lives of father and son. A complex, epic vision of the corruption of American society, the film is widely considered to be as good as, if not better than the original. It won several Academy Awards including Best Picture, Director, Supporting Actor (DeNiro), Screenplay, Score and Art direction/set decoration and was followed by “The Godfather. Part III” sixteen years later.
Cast also includes: Robert Duvall, Dianne Keaton, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Lee Strasberg, Michel V. Gazzo, Troy Donahue, and Danny Aiello. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Di Drew and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: At the Foot of the Arapiles
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.

results.title: The Godfather [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Albert Ruddy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stephanie Moore
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.

results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: Newstead Community Garden
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the town of Newstead held a summit in 2008, the idea of a community garden grew out of it. With the help of a grant and the support of locals and volunteers, the land surrounding the All Saints Anglican Church has become a thriving biodynamic garden. It is a great place for the community to come together, dig and get to know one another.
